summary: Many states conduct Medicaid demonstrations, which allow them to test new approaches for delivering Medicaid services. The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services monitors spending under these demonstrations to ensure that the federal government does not pay more for them than it would have paid for the state's traditional Medicaid program. We found that, over the last decade, Medicaid has spent increasing amounts on these...
title: Medicaid Demonstrations: Federal Action Needed to Improve Oversight of Spending
